titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 963) to amend title 9 of the United States Code with respect to arbitration, and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2116) to prohibit discrimination based on an individualâ€™s texture or style of hair.

Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 963) to amend title 9 of the United States Code with respect to arbitration, and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2116) to prohibit discrimination based on an individual's texture or style of hair.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 117-273, by Mrs. Torres (CA).
The rule provides for one hour of general debate on both H.R. 963 and H.R. 2116.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 69.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 979.

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - At the conclusion of debate on H. Res. 979, the Chair put the question on ordering the previous question and by voice vote, announced the ayes had prevailed. Mrs. Fischbach demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 219 - 204 (Roll no. 73).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 219 - 207 (Roll no. 74).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: This resolution sets rules for the consideration of H.R. 963 (prohibiting certain predispute arbitration agreements) and H.R. 2116 (prohibiting discrimination based on texture or style of hair).
